And Hakuin is a really wonderful character in many ways in the history of Zen. He was enlightened originally at the age of 24 at the sound of the temple gong, just like the gong we just heard. And it was a very deep enlightenment, but at the same time, immediately thereafter, an enormous arrogance formed. And he became very difficult to handle.

And in reflection, years later, he said it was only the killing sword of his teacher who stayed with him and continued to work on the arrogance that evolved after his enlightenment that actually opened his heart to the way.

So Hakuin Zenji's Song of Zazen:

"Sentient beings are, in essence, Buddhas. It's like ice and water. There's no ice without water. There are no Buddhas outside sentient beings. What a shame that sentient beings seek afar, not knowing what is at hand. It's like wailing from thirst in the midst of water or wandering lost among the poor, although born a rich man's child.

"The cause of rebirth in the six realms is the darkness of our delusion. Treading dark path after dark path, when can we escape birth and death? Zazen goes beyond all praise. Giving, keeping precepts and the other perfections, chanting Buddha's name, repentance, training, and many other kinds of wholesome deeds all find their source in Zazen.

"When you sit even once, the merit obliterates countless wrongdoings. How can there be evil realms? The pure land is not far. If by good fortune you have the occasion to hear this teaching, admire it, and rejoice in it, you will attain boundless happiness. How much more if you dedicate yourself and realize your own nature directly.

"This own nature is no nature. You are already apart from useless discussions. The gate opens where cause and effect are inseparable. The road of not two, not three, goes straight ahead. Make the form formless form, going and returning, not anywhere else. Make the thought thoughtless thought, singing and dancing the Dharma voice.

"How vast the sky of unobstructed concentration. How brilliant the full moon of four-fold wisdom. At this very moment, what can be sought? Nirvana is immediate. This place is the lotus land. This body is the Buddha body."
